title: Disguise Self
content:
Disguise Self Level 1 Illusion Spell Magically change all aspects of your appearance. Action Level 1 Spell Slot

Level 1 Illusion Spell

Magically change all aspects of your appearance.

Disguise self is a Spell in Baldur's Gate 3. Disguise self is a Lvl 1 Spell from the Illusion school. Spells can be used for dealing damage to Enemies, inflict Status Ailments, buff Characters or interact with the environment.

Disguise Self Information

Description: Magically change all aspects of your appearance. Until Long Rest Level: Lvl 1 Spell School: Illusion Casting Time: Action Range: Self Requires Concentration: No Saving Throw: None Additional Details: Disguise self changes the caster into another race, from the following options: Halfling, Half-Elf, Elf, Dwarf, Tiefling, Drow, Human, and Githyanki. The caster can also change their gender. Ritual Spell: Yes

How to Acquire Disguise Self

Disguise Self can be acquired by the following classes: Bard, Sorcerer, Wizard, Arcane Trickster, Eldritch Knight, Gloom Stalker, Trickery Domain, Warlock (Mask of Many Faces invocation) Disguise Self can be cast by using the following Items: Mask of the Shapeshifter (Digital Deluxe Edition). Travel to Emerald Grove campsite and open the Traveler's Chest.

Bard, Sorcerer, Wizard, Arcane Trickster, Eldritch Knight, Gloom Stalker, Trickery Domain, Warlock (Mask of Many Faces invocation)

Mask of the Shapeshifter (Digital Deluxe Edition). Travel to Emerald Grove campsite and open the Traveler's Chest.

Disguise Self Tips & Notes

Disguise Self is a ritual spell which can be cast without expending a spell slot outside combat. Can be used to squeeze through cracks too narrow for a medium sized creature and gain access to some areas. If you still can't fit, try combine a small race with the Enlarge - Reduce spell to become tiny. Can be used in conjunction with Speak with Dead to fool a corpse you killed to speak with you. Can be used in conjunction with Friends to fool a merchant if you drop the disguise before the merchant can accuse you of having enchanted him or her. Can be used to unlock magical weapon bonuses tied to race, e.g. gain +1d4 Psychic damage with Soulbreaker Greatsword even if you're another race using Disguise Self: Githyanki. Bug: You can't use reactions while using Disguise Self. There's a mod on BG3 Nexus that adresses that issue however.
